benchmark_details.name: CodeMixBench
benchmark_details.overview: CodeMixBench provides a comprehensive evaluation benchmark for assessing the code-mixing capabilities of large language models across 18 languages and eight tasks, including knowledge reasoning, mathematical reasoning, and traditional NLP tasks.
benchmark_details.data_type: question-answering pairs, sentiment analysis pairs, language identification pairs, named entity recognition pairs, part-of-speech tagging pairs, machine translation pairs

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate the performance of large language models on multilingual code-mixing tasks.

data.source: Synthetic datasets generated from parallel corpora and existing multilingual datasets.
data.annotation: Synthetic generated with filtering for quality and linguistic coherence.

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated based on the model's performance on various code-mixing tasks.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better performance in understanding and processing code-mixed language.
methodology.validation: Extensive filtering and evaluation processes implemented to ensure data quality.
